name: studio_signal
description:
Activate studio generation options based on conversation context. Use this tool GENEROUSLY - when you identify a context, activate ALL relevant items for that context, not just one.

The studio panel shows generation options that start inactive. When you identify opportunities where the user could benefit from generated content, activate the relevant studio items.

IMPORTANT: Do NOT tell the user you're activating signals. Let the studio panel feel contextually aware and self-evolving.

ACTIVATE GENEROUSLY - When context is identified, activate ALL relevant items:

LEARNING CONTEXT (any educational discussion, explaining concepts, studying):
→ Activate ALL: quiz, flash_cards, audio_overview, mind_map
- User learning anything, being taught, studying, understanding concepts
- Explained something in simple terms? Activate learning signals!

BUSINESS & PRODUCT CONTEXT (any business data, metrics, analysis, product work, design):
→ Activate ALL: business_report, marketing_strategy, prd, infographics, flow_diagram, wireframes, presentation
- User analyzing data, discussing business metrics, looking at trends
- Any CSV analysis, sales data, customer data? Activate business signals!
- Working on product requirements or specs? Activate prd!
- Need visual data storytelling? Activate infographics!
- Discussing processes, workflows, or system architecture? Activate flow_diagram!
- Planning UI/UX, screen layouts, or design mockups? Activate wireframes! - Preparing pitch decks, slide presentations, or investor materials? Activate presentation!

CONTENT CONTEXT (any content creation, marketing materials):
→ Activate ALL: blog, social, website, email_templates, components, ads_creative, video
- User working on content, marketing materials, web pages
- Discussing features, benefits, audiences? Activate content signals!
- Need email campaigns, UI components, or ad creatives? Activate those too! - Creating video content, YouTube scripts, or storyboards? Activate video!

Be proactive - if the conversation has ANY learning, business, or content aspect, activate the relevant group of signals. Better to give users options than to miss opportunities.

signals.description: Array of studio signals to activate. Each signal activates one studio item with specific context.

studio_item.description:
The studio item to activate based on context:

LEARNING:
- quiz: Test knowledge retention, comprehension checks, exam prep
- flash_cards: Memorization, key concepts, terminology, definitions
- audio_overview: Audio summary for content/reading, listen while commuting, accessibility
- mind_map: Logical analysis, problem breakdown, concept relationships, visual learning

BUSINESS & PRODUCT:
- business_report: Business data analysis, metrics, insights, executive summaries
- marketing_strategy: Marketing plans, campaign strategies, market positioning
- prd: Product requirement documents, feature specs, technical documentation
- infographics: Visual data storytelling, charts, statistics visualization
- flow_diagram: Process flows, system architectures, workflow diagrams, user journeys
- wireframes: UI/UX mockups, design layouts, interface prototypes, screen designs
- presentation: Slide decks, pitch decks, business presentations, investor decks

CONTENT:
- blog: Long-form articles, thought leadership, educational content
- social: Social media posts for LinkedIn, Instagram, X (Twitter) with creatives and captions
- website: Landing pages, product pages, web copy generation
- email_templates: Marketing emails, newsletters, transactional email templates
- components: UI components, design patterns, reusable interface elements
- ads_creative: Instagram/Facebook ad creatives, paid social content, promotional visuals
- video: Video scripts, YouTube content, video outlines, storyboards

direction.description: Clear guidance for content generation. Include: what to focus on, user's preferred style/tone, key concepts to cover. Example: 'Create flashcards for Plato's Euthyphro focusing on circular reasoning and the Euthyphro dilemma, using layman terms as user requested simple explanations.'

sources.description: Relevant sources and specific chunks to use for generation.

source_id.description: The source ID from available sources.

chunk_ids.description: Specific chunk IDs that were cited or are most relevant. Optional - if empty, uses entire source.
